I am Mohammad Imrul Jubair. I completed my MSc in Computer Science from the University of Calgary, Canada under the supervision of Dr. Usman R. Alim. I was as a member of the Visualization and Graphics Group within the Graphics Jungle Lab. I completed my BSc in Computer Science and Information Technology from the Islamic University of Technology, Dhaka. I also worked as a teaching assistant at University of Calgary from Fall 2014 to Fall 2016. Currently, I am working as a faculty member in Computer Science and Engineering at Ahasanullah University of Science and Technology, Dhaka. [Download CV]

Awards

  1. [Oct 2016] Workshop Grant, German Climate Computing Center (DKRZ).
  2. [Oct 2016] CPSC Travel Award, University of Calgary.
  3. [Sep 2015 - Sep 2016] Research Award (1st year of MSc), University of Calgary.
  4. [Sep 2014 - Sep 2015] Research Award (2nd year of MSc), University of Calgary.
  5. [Sep 2014 - Sep 2015] International Recruitment Graduate Award, University of Calgary.
  6. [Jan 2008 - Oct 2011] Undergraduate Student Scholarship, Islamic University of Technology.

Research

I have interest in Visualization, Graphics and Computer Vision. In my MSc research, I collaborated with the German Climate Computing Centre (DKRZ) and developed a technique called "Icosahedral Maps" for efficient multiresolution visualization of climate model, i.e. ICON (Icosahedral Nonhydrostatic) model.


I also have interest in Image Processing and Computer Vision since my undergrad. Previously, I worked on noise removal, book detection and OCR. I am currently involved in deep learnig based projects [see my curent projects].


Selected publications:

  1. Hoque O., Jubair M. I., Islam M. S., Akash A. & Paulson A., "Real Time Bangladeshi Sign Language Detection using Faster R-CNN" (Accepted), ICIET 2018.
  2. Jubair M. I., “Icosahedral Maps for a Multiresolution Representation of Earth Data”, MSc thesis, Department of Computer Science, University of Calgary, 2017. [slides]
  3. Jubair M. I., Alim U., Röber N., Clyne J. & Mahdavi-Amiri A., “Icosahedral Maps for a Multiresolution Representation of Earth Data”, VMV 2016. [paper]
  4. Jubair M. I., Alim U., Röber N., Clyne J., Mahdavi-Amiri A. & Samavati. F., “Multiresolution Visualization of Digital Earth Data via Hexagonal Box Spline Wavelets”, IEEE VIS 2015. [paper] [poster]
  5. Jubair M. I. & Banik P., “A Technique to Detect Books from Library Bookshelf Image”, IEEE ICCC 2013. [paper] [code]
  6. Jubair M. I., Rahman M. M., Ashfaqueuddin S. & Ziko I. M., “An enhanced decision based adaptive median filtering technique to remove Salt and Pepper noise in digital images”, ICCIT 2011. [paper]

Visit my Google Scholar page.
